page.title: 20CHURCHES IN ST VEEP & GOLANT
page.content: The church of {St. Veep}has a 57 foot tower which houses the only known set of{virgin bells}in England. They were cast in the year 1770. The present building dates from 1336 when it was rededicated by Bishop Grandisson of Exeter. The church houses eight solid granite pillars, a granite font and an altar supported by granite legs. The pulpit is decorated with remnants of a rood screen from an Oxfordshire church. { St. Sampson}is a small church at the top of the hill in Golant. It was built before 1281.The present building was consecrated by the suffragan of Bishop Oldham in 1509. The{methodist}chapel in Lerryn has been closed and converted into flats, but the chapel in Golant is still a place of worship.
